banner-message: Welcome to the new Lifemap! This completely redesigned version offers new features for an enhanced experience. If you encounter any issues, find bugs, or have suggestions for improvements, please contact us at {mail}
author: The Author
credits-notice: For any questions, comments, or suggestions, please send an email to {mail}.
lifemap-baseline: Exploring the entire tree of life
platform-description:
Lifemap is a platform for interactively exploring the evolutionary relationships between all known species, offering detailed information on all clades and links to other resources. 

It serves as an educational and research tool, enhancing the understanding of biodiversity and the evolutionary history of life on Earth.
platform-figures: As of {date} Lifemap contains {totalSpecies} species ({eukaryotes} eukaryotes, {archaea} archaea and {bacteria} bacteria). Last updated on {lastUpdateDate}
license-notice: Lifemap by {author} / CNRS is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.
publication-notice: If you use Lifemap for your publications, please cite: de Vienne DM (2016) Lifemap: Exploring the Entire Tree of Life. {journal} 14(12): e2001624. doi: 10.1371/journal.pbio.2001624.
lifemap-not-available-message: Sorry Lifemap is not available for the moment. Please try again later
taxon-retrieval-error-message: An error occurred while retrieving taxa data
taxon-suggestions-error-message: An error occurred while fetching taxon suggestions
ancestor-error-message: An error occurred while retrieving taxa ancestries
failed-to-retrieve-taxon-info-message: An error occurred while fetching taxon data
no-wikipedia-article-message: No article concerning this group on Wikipedia
no-wikipedia-article-in-preferred-langua: No article concerning this group in preferred or fallback language on Wikipedia.
wikipedia-article-summary-not-found-mess: An error occurred while fetching article summary concerning this group on Wikipedia
wikipedia-articles-not-found-message: An error occurred while fetching articles concerning this group on Wikipedia
age-description: {timetree} is a public knowledge-base for information on the evolutionary timescale of life. Data from thousands of published studies are assembled into a searchable tree of life scaled to time.
wikipedia-language-message: Preferred language for wikipedia content can be configured in parameters
help-lifemap: {lifemap} is an interactive tool to explore the tree of life. The concept used in {lifemap} is similar to the one used in cartography with tools like Google Maps© or OpenStreetMap: exploring is done by zooming and panning.
help-tree: The current tree contains {species} species: {archaea} Archaea, {bacteria} Bacteria and {eukaryotes} Eukaryotes. It is based on the taxonomy published by the NCBI and updated regularly.
help-nodes: All the nodes in the tree are clickable. It displays information (description and picture) concerning the taxa (retrieved from the Wikipedia page, if any). If you have description or pictures you would like to see in Lifemap, simply create or update the corresponding Wikipedia page.
help-itineraries: Itineraries between taxa can be computed by clicking on the icon {itineraryIcon}. When filling the two new search fields, the route is drawn between the taxa and the Most Recent Common Ancestor (MRCA) of the two groups/species is returned. The user gets also access to a list of all the nodes that are encountered in the way from one group to the other. This list is clickable.
help-credits: Lifemap was written by Damien M. de Vienne (web page), a CNRS researcher working in the Laboratory of Biometry and Evolutionary Biology (LBBE) in Lyon (France) with support from the informatics departement (especially Stephane Delmotte and Bruno Spataro).
luca-description: The last universal common ancestor (LUCA) is the hypothesized common ancestral cell from which the three domains of life, the Bacteria, the Archaea, and the Eukarya originated
